title: Subodh Gupta
summary: Subodh Gupta (born 1964) is a prominent Indian contemporary artist based in New Delhi. His extensive body of work spans sculpture, installation, painting, photography, performance, and video. After early struggles post-graduation from art college in Patna, he gained significant recognition through international exhibitions like the Fukuoka Asian Art Triennale (1999) and the Gwangju Biennale (2000). His early association with Khoj Studios also influenced his career, and his work is often linked to the tradition of Marcel Duchamp.
key_points: Subodh Gupta is an Indian contemporary artist based in New Delhi.
His artistic practice is multidisciplinary, encompassing sculpture, installation, painting, photography, performance, and video.
He pursued his art education at the College of Arts & Crafts, Patna, from 1983 to 1988.
After moving to Delhi, he faced initial struggles before gaining international recognition.
Early career turning points include exhibitions at the Fukuoka Asian Art Triennale (1999) and the Gwangju Biennale (2000).
His work is described as being in the tradition of the French surrealist Marcel Duchamp.
